intro: Selago thyrsoidea var. austrorhodesica, commonly known as the New Zealand selago, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a creeping habit, often forming dense mats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, aromatic scent, which is a common trait among members of its family.
